video.title: 2D Game Development with GDevelop - Crash Course
video.description:
Learn how to create games with GDevelop, a 2D cross-platform, free and open-source game engine. You can create games with minimal coding and run them on most major platforms.

✏️ Course created by Wesley and Max.

🔗 Learn more about Gdevelop: https://gdevelop.io/
🔗 More GDevelop video tutorials: https://www.youtube.com/c/GDevelopApp/featured

🎨 Links to artists:
🔗 https://www.kenney.nl/
🔗 https://0x72.itch.io/dungeontileset-ii

⭐️ Course Contents ⭐️
⌨️ (0:00:00) Intro
⌨️ (0:00:22) General Layout
⌨️ (0:06:34) Object Types
⌨️ (0:10:51) Event System
⌨️ (0:16:03) Jumpstarting
⌨️ (0:20:55) Variables
⌨️ (0:25:33) Expression Builder
⌨️ (0:30:01) Extensions
⌨️ (0:33:18) Re-creating Asteroids
⌨️ (0:43:18) Exporting A Game
⌨️ (0:46:36) Outro

🎉 Thanks to our Champion and Sponsor supporters:
👾 Raymond Odero
👾 Agustín Kussrow
👾 aldo ferretti
👾 Otis Morgan
👾 DeezMaster

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://freecodecamp.org/news

topLevelComment.text: A lot of new Game Engines these days, it's pretty much Unity, Unreal Engine, the main stays with possibly some CryEngine and now Godot popping up more often and some html5 game engines for the web devs that don't want to learn C++/C#. Yes I know we already have useful templates, but think Mario maker game engine and drag and drop everything, maybe that's just lazyness and no real effort or progress? Hmmm...back to the drawing board lol

replies.author: Paul Hughes
replies.text: @Ahmad I think once you know one engine especially Unreal or Unity, the others don't take too much learning, some html5 stuff like phasor is a bit different but again the engine makeup is similar. I enjoyed a little SDL and SFML just to get my engine library knowledge up a little with C++, even creating your own engine in C or Python will help for using future libraries and engines etc. Godot is really picking up speed but still not the finished article, it's cementing itself as no.3 engine especially for beginners as a lot like GDScript, myself I prefer C#, lovely language, C++ in unreal doesn't do it for me compared to C#, I think blueprints is ok but has limitations, a mix of both os fine as blueprints can turn into spaghetti real fast. I really wished UE5 used C# tho. Godots GDScript has influenced UE5s scripting. It's hard to tell 5-10 yeara from who will be on top, but whomever has easiest scripting, using Mobile in 2D/3D, Desktop/Console, XR compatability Hololens/MetaVerse etc plus WebXR will do the best I think. I do think though as Ive just noticed with Unity maybe trying to do too much it leaves other devs behind, I waited nearly 2 years to use the remote 5 with new UI touch/joystick, as they are too focused on catching UE. Unity should have stuck to mobile/portable/Desktop/XR, and let UE focus on High End Desktop/XR, who knows puting all ur eggs in one basket can be dangerous! I got burned with Google Daydream should have chosen Oculus but would have eventually, lost over a year tho, so yeah better doing more than one proj at a time. ✌

topLevelComment.author: Aaron Misner
topLevelComment.text:
This video should serve as a model for all future game development courses. The pacing, editing, examples, highlighting, coverage and focus on important concepts, all sprinkled with just the right amount of humor helped ensure that it was engaging throughout without getting bogged down with too many details. I felt it gave the viewer what they needed to get up and running without wasting their time.

Also (and possibly most importantly) there was no overlay of video of some person talking in the corner of the screen. I hope presenters in the future looking to make video tutorials take note. This video is how it should be done. 🏆

replies.author: GDevelop
replies.text:
Arrays and structures are supported - and there is no "unique id" for objects to allow the engine to optimise how things are done internally. But you can easily set a variable with a unique number to instance you want to pick, and structure your events so that you don't even need a unique id.
Finally in the future we'll add a capability to remember objects in memory and pick them again easily afterwards! :) 

- Florian
